channel.title: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA
channel.description:
Hey guys,
a few days ago, I found [this](https://github.com/iadgov) on GitHub. These are "Information Assurance" tools made by the NSA. Most of them are about attack mitigation, but I REALLY don't trust this. I haven't read the complete source code yet, but I wonder why the NSA would share tools that could help to keep them out of one's system. Maybe I'm just paranoid.
Anyway, I thought some of you might be interested in it, so here it is.
* Neo

item.title: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed after 30 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA

item.title: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA
item.dc:creator: Neo
item.description:
Yes, it’s official. I think they stated it was a reaction on the ShadowBrokers, they wanted to be more transparent to regain some public trust. Didn’t work on me, but it’s still nice to see some NSA-grade sourcecode.

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA

item.title: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA
item.dc:creator: Valentine
item.description:
I’m suspicious of this. Why would the NSA release their tools unless of course this is part of a grand plan to catch hackers. Wouldn’t be surprised.

Cheers.

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA

item.title: Blue Team Tools - made by NSA
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
DOPE share. I wonder how long it will be until they get taken down?

EDIT: oh wait! Is it official?

Read full topic
